Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Alpha-Blockers as Adjuvant Therapy in Shock Wave Lithotripsy

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive alpha-blockers plus usual care or usual care alone.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved adults undergoing SWL for renal or ureteral stones.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive alpha-blockers plus usual care or usual care alone.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was stone clearance rate, assessed within 4 weeks post-SWL.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 4793 participants were randomised: 2396 to the intervention group and 2397 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 4084 participants using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Alpha-blockers may improve stone clearance (RR 1.16, 95% CI 1.09 to 1.23), potentially increasing clearance from 69.3% to 80.4%.

Harms.evidence: No drug-related major adverse events were reported; most were emergency room visits or rehospitalizations.
